results.title: The Firefighter, Police helicopter, Police officer
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, Chris O'Rourke and James Mann
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
Shows the work done by a firefighter, by policemen who man the police helicopter and the work of a various police officers from senior sargents to motor cycle police. The duties and responsibilities of each profession and the necessary equipment and supplies required by each person in order to get the job done.

results.title: The Fire in the Stone
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Pamela Vanneck and G Conway
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Colin Thiele, tells the story of Ernie, a teenager living in Coober Pedy with his no-hoper father. Ernie dreams of re-uniting his separated mother and father with the proceeds from the opal he is going to find one day. His dream, however, becomes a nightmare, when he stumbles across a small fortune in opals … which are then stolen. Rated: G

results.title: The Fire brigade
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Joan Boundy
results.brief_description: The story of training a young recruit in every aspect of his duty as a fireman attached to a large metropolitan fire brigade. Equipment is demonstrated in detail, including its actual use in a spectacular city fire.

results.title: The Fir tree
results.creator_credit: Huntingwood Films, Kevin Sullivan and Martin Hunter
results.brief_description: Christmas story about a fir tree, which, discontented with its lot in the forest, is granted its wish for adventure and is chosen to be a family’s Christmas tree. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Finished people
results.creator_credit: Post 75 Productions, Open Family Australia and Khoa Do
results.brief_description: A fine example of low budget filmmaking executed with a realistic fervour. Set in Sydney’s Cabramatta, three homeless youth struggle with the boredom, danger and many frustrations of life on the streets. Tommy (Jason McGoldrick) tries to overcome his drug addiction that started at a very young age. Van (Joe Le) sleeps in a car park but finds an unlikely camaraderie with a girl named Carla. Des (Rodney Anderson) gets involved with crims to try and etch out a living for himself and his pregnant girlfriend. Portrayed with a realism brought about by a young cast performing for film for the first time and based on a script written by those living a hard life, “The Finished People” provides a powerful insight into the world of homeless youth in suburban Australia. Although sometimes grim, moments of true human connection demonstrate that these young adults are not ‘Finished People’ at all.

results.title: The Fine art of aggression
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Ronald Shedlo and Jack Gold
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Presents a story of one man’s ruthless determination to succeed in business at the expense of his co-workers. Shows how destruction of self and others results when an unthwarted will goes beyond the norms of reason. Edited from the Columbia Pictures 1969 motion picture entitled “The Reckoning”.

results.title: The Find of '93
results.creator_credit: Southern Cross Newsreels and R.H. Miller
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Golden West Series”.
Paddy Hannan’s find in 1893 led to the development of Kalgoorlie. Over 28 million ounces of fine gold have been taken from the “Golden Mile’s” open cut and deep mines. Demonstrates the mining process from power drilling of the ore bearing rock to crushing, screening and grinding of the ore. Washing and treating before processing in flotation cells, storage before smelting and finally the bullion is produced ready for the last smelting at the Royal Mint.

group_siblings.title: True Australians

results.title: The Find me book: self help in action
results.brief_description: The Volunteer Emergency Reserve was established in 1965 and acts as a vital backup to the Victoria Police in emergencies. In 1974, the VER was called in to assist in the search for a young boy lost in the bush. This child was not found, but to help prevent further such tragedies the “Find me book” was devised. The distinctive orange colored pages of the book can be torn out and used by the lost person to mark their way. Points on how to stay comfortable in the bush are also given.

results.title: The Final hour of Joan of Arc
results.creator_credit: Young America Films, Columbia Broadcasting System, James Fonda and Bernard Girard
results.brief_description: One of the “You are There” television series, which reconstructs the events of 29th and 30th May, 1431, at Rouen. Spurred on by the English, who wish to ensure that Joan does not revive the campaign against them, the Church authorities press the interrogation of Joan, and next day have her burnt at the stake as a “lapsed heretic”. Includes Dianna Lynn as Joan. Written for television by Milton Geiger; director of photography by Ed Fitzgerald and narrated by Walter Cronkite.
